title: Elevating Manufacturing in Africa
description: African producers lack access to market, working capital and supply chains. They can't scale their business and earn income beyond survival.

f6_assessments.q0:
This a well written proposal with a clear solution that addresses the Challenge of growing Africa alongside Cardano.
The proposal ave a real world application and potential to help African in the Manufacturing and Industrial Sector.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal did a great work of providing evidence of experience to solve the in which the attached materials (https://youtu.be/MTewhzjct9o,https://youtu.be/M142fYeBdM4) did a great job of driving down both the solution and the implementation plan.  
The proposal demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of the manufacturing problems plaguing Africa.
I strongly Agree that the proposal can be implemented with provided experience and implementation plan. Kudos to the team.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal did a great job of highlighting timelines, milestones and a breakdown of individual cost implications.
Considering how challenging addressing the solution of the proposal, the  team where considerate with the request amount and clearly understand the need to give room for other projects to be funded.
considering the above, i strongly agree that the proposal presented quality information that will help to audit the Solution.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is aligned perfectly with the Grow Africa, Grow Cardano challenge. The team have successfully identified existing work practices and issues related to  various forms of manufacturing in Africa and detailed a vision of how those problems could be addressed. In addition to simple problem solving, standards of openness, fairness, efficiency and sustainability are all enhanced. It is very clear that a successful implementation of a project of this type would be of great interest and benefit to its users and has the potential for the scale adoption that would help advance Cardano in Africa.
f6_assessments.q1: The management team has extensive relevant experience and is well aligned to the project proposal. The proposal and supporting material demonstrate a thorough understanding of the current market conditions and the activity required to develop the various components of the proposed system. I have had many years of experience in the area of commercial business development and the team's white paper, that runs to 57 pages, is as good as any I have seen from a new organisation. More detail around implementation, particularly in relation to the budget would have been useful but the information provided was enough to give an adequate picture of the next 12-18 months.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has clear well defined goals. Systems are already in place not only to begin implementation but also to capture data related to outcomes and progress. The project is already sufficiently mature, with enough momentum to improve the likelihood of success and the ease to which that success or otherwise could be audited.

f6_assessments.q0:
Uganda, Kenya and  Tanzania good focus area as the is major internet investment and upgrades.
It is a good region to cluster, as many multi national companies also cluster those 3 countries.
I think this can be extended to other regions in Africa e.g. SADC where there a export/trade agreements in place and also more southern Africa where internet and other infrastructure is much more available.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is already good momentum - and this would give a good push to the next step of activation. 
Logistics in Africa is always a challenge and needs to be extra cautious in under promise and over deliver.
Also suggest the DApps need to enable simplistic/limited functionality at first to support the core process that you are trying to enable. But be ready for scalability later
f6_assessments.q2:
The outline of tasks are good - trackable granularity and specs should be considered to be added. 
Also - the first steps (linking up with Assessment note) to be a smaller step - POC (proof of concept) - and then onboard more volume, as its easier to expand and scale than to back track and recover. The latter also has a huge element of - its more difficult to convince if people have lost confidence, than to take smaller steps - but constantly forward.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal deal with a very important issue and a big challenge across the supply chains in Africa which are highly inefficient for the producers. The problem and solution are well presented and well fit the challenge objectives of having Cardano as the blockchain for Africa-related initiatives. 

When I was at Earthwrom.org, I worked for a couple of years on agriculture supply chains and understand some of the complexities and challenges on the ground for producers as well as for B2B buyers. So I can clearly relate to the benefits of such a proposal.

The project is very ambitious and it will have many challenged on the way, but definitely a worthwhile cause to focus on.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project is already underway getting traction with producers and clients. Well done on that. The plan vs. the idea is well aligned. I have worked with many startups through the years (i.e. with Seedstars, Givingway.com) and this proposal is well presented with a good focus and plan. 

The website and videos look great and provide a good impression of the quality of the work of the team. Also, very good attached materials show a lot of work and thoughts already dedicated.

Great team with complementary background & skills, with a good overview of each member's relevant experience and passion. Very good list of supporting advisors. 

The budget seems reasonable for such an ambitious project and the team understands they will need to raise more funds as they advanced to realize the project. Having some information about the business model would and market have supported the investment and scale opportunity.
 
Regarding the budget, it would have been good to get more details of how each item was calculated and what will be deliverables. 

One remark is that it would have been good to show already in the first 3 months a milestone related to the Cardano/blockchain integration.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a clear roadmap and timeline over 3,6, 12 months. KPIs are also very clear and measurables with specific targets i.e. in terms of Pisces produced and sold and a number of collectives on board. 

Adding risks and challenges would is important as I believe that there are many which need to be considered as the company aim to "disrupt a historical exploitative industry"

solution: The Waya DAO coordinates a network of local African producers, enabling them to serve international markets effectively.
experience: We are a tech-savvy and diverse team based in Uganda and Europe. We are entrepreneurs with a background in blockchain, finance and business.
